summary:
In math, the square root of a number *x* is a number that, when multiplied by itself, gives *x*. For example, 4 is a square root of 16.

The principal square root, often just called "the square root," is the positive one. It is written as √*x*. For instance, √9 = 3.

Every positive number has two square roots: one positive and one negative. These can be shown as ±√*x*.
title: Square root
